description: Retail sales data capturing item visibility, outlet characteristics, and sales performance, enabling insights into product performance across different outlet types and locations.

metadata.description: Unique identifier for each item in the dataset, used to track and manage inventory.
Weight of the item in kilograms; Represents the physical weight of the product.
Indicates the fat content level of the item, categorized as either 'Low Fat' or 'Regular'.
The visibility score of the item in the store; A higher score indicates better visibility to customers.
Category of the item being sold; Represents the type of product such as Dairy, Soft Drinks, or Meat.
Maximum retail price of the item; Represents the highest price at which the item is sold.
Unique identifier for each retail outlet where the items are sold.
Year when the outlet was established; Indicates the age of the outlet in the market.
Size category of the outlet; Indicates whether the outlet is classified as Small, Medium, or Large.
Classification of the outlet's location; Indicates whether the outlet is in a Tier 1, Tier 2, or Tier 3 area.
Type of retail outlet where the item is sold; Categorizes the outlet into types such as Supermarket, Grocery, etc.
Total sales amount generated by the item at the outlet; Represents revenue in the local currency.
